title: End Geoblocking
description: Every day, artificial digital borders block millions of Europeans from ordering goods, purchasing movies on demand or watching videos. Now the EU is considering taking action. Join us in demanding: End geoblocking!
tape: Every day, artificial digital borders block millions of Europeans from ordering goods, purchasing movies on demand or watching videos.
now: Now the EU is considering taking action.

appeal.fight: The fight to end geoblocking in the EU has begun.
appeal.voice: It can only be successful if you raise your voice!
appeal.signup: Sign up here so we can inform you when it's time to contact the right EU politicians:

privacy: Privacy policy: We won't spam you or share your data with anyone.
friends: Now, please scroll down to share this page with your friends.

discrimination.title: Geoblocking is discrimination
discrimination.pretext: Linguistic minorities, long-term migrants, exchange students, etc. – 1 in 10 Europeans
discrimination.abbr: 1 in 10 Europeans speak a minority language - Davyth Hicks, ELEN
discrimination.posttext: are denied access to their culture online.

artists.title: Geoblocking locks in artists
artists.text: Many artists' works are denied a Europe-wide audience – and fans ready to pay are turned away.

audiences.title: Geoblocking locks out audiences
audiences.text: Language learners, foreign sports league fans etc. are forced to pay VPNs instead of creators, or seek out illegal sources.

principles.title: Geoblocking betrays EU principles
principles.text: The EU is supposed to be a single market. Geoblocking undermines that. The EU must act – like it did on roaming.

economy.title: Geoblocking harms the economy
economy.text: Up to 1.6 billion Euros worth of cross-border demand is kept from EU VoD platforms, EU startups and artists.

voices.title: Voices against geoblocking
voices.text: Politicians, consumer advocates, minority representatives, startup associations, regional Parliaments and many more have come out against geoblocking.

stat.title: And here's what users like you say:
stat.consultation: Public consultation by the European Commission, 2016 (among individual respondents)

julia.text: Geoblocking is the most anachronistic, un-European, un-digital practice on the web. This year, we have the chance to end it in the EU – whether we succeed depends on whether people will speak up. supports this campaign
julia.position: Member of the European Parliament (Pirate Party, Greens/EFA group)

elen.text: Geoblocking undermines regional minority lanuage usage. ... Usually-connected cross-border regions become digitally disconnected. This is ridiculous! supports this campaign

bermejo.text: Geoblocking is nonsense in today's world, especially when we are working on building worldwide companies and a European Digital Single Market. [...] People don't understand why geoblocking exists.supports this campaign
